definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: The children were making too much noise, and he faced them down.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们喧闹不堪，他板起面孔把他们镇住了。

sentences.english: Wu Sun-fu listened attentively, his eyes riveted on Chao Potao's face.
sentences.chinese: 吴荪甫很注意地听着，眼光射定了赵伯韬的面孔。

sentences.english: Solidarity with everything that has a human face?
sentences.chinese: 与一切有着人类面孔的事情休戚与共？

sentences.english: I know that I found it beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我发现那张面孔很美丽。

sentences.english: New version of iciba gave her new face to everybody in the particular area.
sentences.chinese: 新版爱词霸在这块特有的领地里给大家一幅新面孔。

sentences.english: The sight that met my eyes made it hard to keep a straight face.
sentences.chinese: 映入眼帘的情景使我难以板起面孔。
柯瑟琳凝视着这两张面孔。

sentences.english: This suggests the ability to recognize faces is heritable.
sentences.chinese: 这说明面孔辨识能力是可遗传的。

sentences.english: He stiffened and wiped his face with the back of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 这时，他板起了面孔，用手背揩往了眼泪。

sentences.english: His face told me clearly that he was connected with Bardfield.
sentences.chinese: 从他的面孔，我清楚地知道他与巴德菲尔德有联系。

sentences.english: After two classes, I started to recognize several of the faces in each class.
sentences.chinese: 两节课下来，每个班上我都已经认得好几张面孔了。

sentences.english: Yes it is me she poaches her old face in.
sentences.chinese: 正是在我身上她窃取了她的旧面孔。

sentences.english: Field cognition mode has no significant influence on the recognition of upright face.
sentences.chinese: 场认知方式对正立面孔的识别没有显著性影响。

sentences.english: Had the board brought in a new face too early, it might have attracted mud.
sentences.chinese: 倘若董事会提早推出一张新面孔，可能会招致非议。

sentences.english: He hoped for a sight of the old, familiar faces.
sentences.chinese: 他希望一见那些熟悉的老面孔。

sentences.english: His pale lined face and luxuriant flowing hair.
sentences.chinese: 他那苍白而布有皱纹的面孔和浓密而飘拂的头发。

definition: five sense organs of TCM (nose, eyes, lips, tongue, ears 鼻目口舌耳)/facial features
